overview:
As a young politico in Washington and on the campaign trail, David watched the Internet change not only politics but every aspect of life – the way we shop, share, work and communicate. He founded the David All Group in 2007 to bring his unique experience, expertise and insights to corporate clients and trade associations.

DAG is expert at utilizing storytelling, curated content and social incentives to empower “brand activists,” the people who promote their favorite products, services and organizations to their social networks. Conversations are in DAG’s DNA. With David’s guidance, DAG has continued to expand and serve more diverse and more global clients, including Fortune 100 brands and industry leaders around the world.

David is a thought leader in social media, marketing, corporate issue advocacy, and public relations. He founded the AMP Summit to provide a platform for industry pioneers to share stories of how technology empowered them to change everything. He co-authored “The Essential Guide To Twitter,” “The Essential Guide to Google+” and “The Essential Guide to Pinterest.”

David’s latest project is Crumbly, a fresh startup based in San Francisco that focuses on building an iPhone app to help friends share and discover great places.

David contributes to many publications and blogs, including PR Week, PR News, AOL’s The Huffington Post and OneNineNinety, DAG’s blog about brand activism and the revolution in social marketing. Follow him on Tumblr and Twitter, add him to your circles on Google+, and subscribe to his updates on Facebook.

David is a runner, surfer and dad to the best French Bulldog in his world, Jackson. He lives in San Francisco.
